definition.name: Separator
definition.purpose: Visually separates content in the UI, either horizontally or vertically.
definition.description: A reusable UI component that renders a visual separator using Radix UI's SeparatorPrimitive. Supports horizontal and vertical orientations, and can be styled via className. Used to divide content sections in layouts or components.

className.description: Additional CSS classes to apply to the separator.

decorative.description: Whether the separator is decorative (not announced by screen readers).

initial.data: A thin line separator, horizontal by default, with optional custom classes.

visible: A line (horizontal or vertical) separating content
enabled: Can change orientation and add custom classes

when.description: The orientation prop is changed by the user or parent component.

from.state: Separator is rendered with current orientation

to.state: Separator is rendered with new orientation

effects: Separator visually changes between horizontal and vertical

when.description: The className prop is changed or provided.

from.state: Separator is rendered with default or previous classes

to.state: Separator is rendered with new classes

effects: Separator receives new styling as per the provided className

definition.visualLayout: A single line (horizontal or vertical) styled with border color and size, stretching to fit its container.
definition.implementationNotes: Wraps Radix UI SeparatorPrimitive.Root. Uses a utility function 'cn' for className merging. Accepts all props supported by SeparatorPrimitive.Root.
